item.title: Report X-2024101786
item.description:
Report X-2024101786

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-12
  • City: SHARONVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING PRELOAD A BOX CAME DOWN METRO BELT AND WHEN IT HIT THE SORT BELT A POP-FLASH OCCURRED AND THE BOX IGNITED. THE BOX WAS QUICKLY PUT OUT AND RESPONDERS CLEANED UP THE AREA AFTER DON PROPER PPE-BOOTS, APRON, GLOVES, AND GOGGLES. THE BOX WAS NOT MARKED FOR A DECLARED SHIPMENT AND HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER WAS NOTIFIED. THE FIRE WAS PUT OUT BY FIRE EXTINGUISHER.

item.title: Report I-2024100155
item.description:
Report I-2024100155

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was loading material in Cleveland, OH. Driver loaded and attempted to offload the amount of product the customer ordered but as he was offloading the tank started to overflow. Driver immediately stopped the flow of product from the truck but 10 gallons of material overflowed into containment. Driver reported that there was no gaging system on the tank.

item.title: Report E-2024100703
item.description:
Report E-2024100703

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 15, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN1789 was crushed during unloading and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the dock floor and cardboard box. R+L personnel utilized a fire extinguisher when they noticed smoke emerging from the box. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel discovered that all released Transchem Muriatic Acid (UN1789) had dried, on the impacted surfaces, due to the fire extinguisher being utilized by R+L personnel. Crews collected the damaged jug and the impacted cardboard box for disposal. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and swept them in with hand tools. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024100685
item.description:
Report E-2024100685

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 1230et the where houseman was loading the trailer for shipment when putting the next tote in the valve was struck on the tote next to it breaking the valve off that tote. The contents then leaked out onto the floor of the trailer with a proximately 15gallons going into the containment at the back of the trailer in the dock. The material was contained to the trailer and the containment at the dock. They had a crew come in and clean the material up and all was completed by 0230et.

item.title: Report E-2024100659
item.description:
Report E-2024100659

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of NALCOÂ® 7330 was punctured by a nail and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. A pH test was performed before remediation and a neutral reading was confirmed. The damaged pail was located and patched to prevent further release of product. Crews utilized rags to wipe down the impacted area to ensure cleaning. The damaged pail and all spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.
